sailpoint.object

Interface Notifiable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CertificationItem, WorkItem

    public interface Notifiable
    Interface for objects that can be reminded, escalated, and expired.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getEscalationCount() 
      java.util.Date getExpirationDate()
      Return the expiration date for this item.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Return the ID of this item.
      NotificationConfig getNotificationConfig()
      Return the NotificationConfig for this item.
      java.lang.String getNotificationName()
      Return a friendly name for this item.
      Identity getNotificationOwner(Resolver resolver)
      Return the "owner" of this item.
      int getRemindersSent()
      Get the number of reminders that have been sent.
      java.util.Date getWakeUpDate()
      Return the date at which this object should next be checked for reminders, escalations, or expiration.
      void incrementEscalationCount()
      Increment the number of escalations.
      void incrementRemindersSent()
      Increment the number of reminders that have been sent.
      boolean isEscalateOnMaxReminders()
      Return whether this item escalates when the maximum number of reminders has been reached.
      boolean isExpirable()
      Return true if this item supports expiration.
      boolean isExpired()
      Return true if this item is expired according to the current time and the expiration date for this item.
      void saveEscalationError(InvalidEscalationTargetException error)
      Save the given escalation error on this item.
      void setWakeUpDate(java.util.Date nextWakeUp)
      Set the date at which this object should next be checked for reminders, escalations, or expiration.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Return the ID of this item.

      • getNotificationName

        java.lang.String getNotificationName()
        Return a friendly name for this item.

      • getNotificationConfig

        NotificationConfig getNotificationConfig()
        Return the NotificationConfig for this item.

      • getWakeUpDate

        java.util.Date getWakeUpDate()
        Return the date at which this object should next be checked for reminders, escalations, or expiration. This should return null if there is nothing left to process on this item.

      • setWakeUpDate

        void setWakeUpDate(java.util.Date nextWakeUp)
        Set the date at which this object should next be checked for reminders, escalations, or expiration.

      • getRemindersSent

        int getRemindersSent()
        Get the number of reminders that have been sent.

      • incrementRemindersSent

        void incrementRemindersSent()
        Increment the number of reminders that have been sent.

      • getNotificationOwner

        Identity getNotificationOwner(Resolver resolver)
                       throws GeneralException
        Return the "owner" of this item. This is the user that should receive reminders or be subject to escalation.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • isEscalateOnMaxReminders

        boolean isEscalateOnMaxReminders()
        Return whether this item escalates when the maximum number of reminders has been reached. This should return false if this item kicks off the escalation process differently.

      • saveEscalationError

        void saveEscalationError(InvalidEscalationTargetException error)
        Save the given escalation error on this item.

      • isExpirable

        boolean isExpirable()
        Return true if this item supports expiration.

      • isExpired

        boolean isExpired()
        Return true if this item is expired according to the current time and the expiration date for this item.

      • getExpirationDate

        java.util.Date getExpirationDate()
        Return the expiration date for this item.

      • incrementEscalationCount

        void incrementEscalationCount()
        Increment the number of escalations.

      • getEscalationCount

        int getEscalationCount()
